content:
I want to move https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-perf/pull/1181 along.

  • I'm happy with how it looks and the changes to the parts of the code that I'm familiar with.
  • @Jakub Ber치nek: there's one test failure on GitHub CI. Is that expected? Can you fix it?
  • @simulacrum , @rylev: are you happy with the code changes?

Since we have agreed that we will use the DB, I'll try to cleanup the code and most of the PR should be done, hopefully. I'm still interested in the SQLite import though - https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-perf/pull/1181#discussion_r817117286. In what scenarios is it being used?

I'm not sure -- it looks like it might be old and/or unnecessary code that we could remove. I think the main use cases are taken care of by the sqlite-to-postgres and postgres-to-sqlite converters we already have.

@Jakub Ber치nek I see you recently updated your PR, excellent. This PR needs to land (and probably https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-perf/pull/1183 as well) before we can start the big benchmarks overhaul.
I'm assuming I'll end up being the one to do the benchmarks overhaul. I'll probably break it into multiple PRs, because I'm scared of doing all of them in one giant PR.
I think we want to add first and then remove, so that we preserve continuity (no commit has no data), but it'll want to be quick to avoid long runtimes too.
CI is broken because of the missing APT package, that needs to be fixed first I guess.
